question: For which conditions and assumptions is the Theis solution appropriate? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct. Theis assumes transient flow in a confined, infinite, homogeneous, isotropic aquifer with a fully penetrating, infinitesimal well and constant discharge.
error: ❌ Recheck the classic Theis assumptions: confined, infinite, homogeneous/isotropic, fully penetrating, constant Q.

question: Which aquifer properties can be estimated by fitting the Theis curve to pumping test drawdown data? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct. Theis fitting yields T and S for confined conditions.
error: ❌ Only T and S are obtained directly from a Theis fit under confined assumptions.

question: Identify the correct mathematical elements of the Theis solution. (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct. Theis uses s = (Q/4πT)W(u) with u = r²S/(4Tt) and the exponential integral well function.
error: ❌ The logarithmic form in D is not the transient Theis solution.

question: Which variables directly influence the dimensionless parameter u in the Theis solution? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct. u depends on r, S, T, and t; it is independent of Q.
error: ❌ Remember: Q scales drawdown magnitude, not u.

question: How does transmissivity T affect the cone of depression and predicted drawdown patterns? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct. T controls how readily flow occurs: high T spreads drawdown; low T concentrates it near the well.
error: ❌ T strongly affects both the shape and spatial distribution of drawdown.

question: Which statements about storativity S in a confined aquifer are correct? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct. S controls storage-driven response and influences early/late time behavior; transmission is governed by T.
error: ❌ Don’t conflate storage (S) with transmission capacity (T).

question: About plotting choices in Theis analysis, which statements are correct? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct. Semi-log supports Cooper–Jacob; log-log is useful for full-range visualization.
error: ❌ Arithmetic plots are not typically preferred for Theis parameter estimation.

question: Late-time mismatch between Theis curves and field data may indicate which issues? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct. Leakage, boundaries, and variable Q commonly cause late-time deviations from Theis.
error: ❌ Late-time deviation usually means Theis assumptions are not fully satisfied.

question: What does the 45° reference line in the measured-vs-computed scatter plot convey, and how is fit quality assessed? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct. Proximity to the 45° line indicates agreement; systematic offsets reveal bias.
error: ❌ RMSE is computed from residuals, not read off the line.

question: Why is a perfect Theis fit rarely achievable for field data? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct. Real systems rarely meet ideal assumptions; external stresses and operational factors add departures.
error: ❌ Theis is transient, not steady-state; reconsider the real-world departures from the ideal model.
